```{r}
library(circtools)
dat <- circtools:::testData()
```

The plotting function accpets:


- exons for the transcript of interest
```{r}
knitr::kable(head(dat$exons), row.names = FALSE)
```

- read counts for the isoforms
```{r}
knitr::kable(head(dat$counts))
```

- annotation of circular RNA candidates (start-end defines the splice junction)
```{r}
knitr::kable(dat$circs)
```

- if defined, a primers set for the transcripts
```{r}
knitr::kable(dat$primers)
```

Also, a minimal aspect ratio of the segments on the plot can be provided.

```{r, fig.height=4, fig.width=7}
plotTranscripts(
  exons = dat$exons,
  counts = dat$counts ,
  primers = dat$primers,
  circs = dat$circs,
  minRatio = .1
)
```
